channel.title: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Oscar Pistorius Guilty Of Culpable Homicide In Girlfiend's Death
item.description: A judge in South Africa has found the double-amputee athlete guilty of culpable homicide, or negligent killing, in the shooting death of his girlfriend Reeva Steenkamp in 2013.
item.content:encoded:
A judge in South Africa has found the double-amputee athlete guilty of culpable homicide, or negligent killing, in the shooting death of his girlfriend Reeva Steenkamp in 2013.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Ofeibea Quist-Arcton

item.title: Turkey, Iran Wary Of U.S. Terms For Fight Against Islamic State
item.description: Both Turkey and Iran have much at stake as the Sunni militants battle for territory close to their respective borders. But each country has its own reasons to be distrustful.
item.content:encoded:
Both Turkey and Iran have much at stake as the Sunni militants battle for territory close to their respective borders. But each country has its own reasons to be distrustful.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Peter Kenyon

item.title: Gaza Home For Disabled Adults Wants Israeli Airstrike Probed
item.description: Israel has announced criminal investigations into 5 incidents during the Gaza war this summer. A home for disabled adults that was targeted is still on the list of possible investigations.
item.content:encoded:
Israel has announced criminal investigations into 5 incidents during the Gaza war this summer. A home for disabled adults that was targeted is still on the list of possible investigations.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Emily Harris

item.title: Far From The Battlefield, U.S. Troops Will Assist Iraqi Forces
item.description: President Obama will send 475 additional troops to Iraq to train, assist and advise Iraqi forces on the fight against militants in the Islamic State. But they will not be involved in combat.
item.content:encoded:
President Obama will send 475 additional troops to Iraq to train, assist and advise Iraqi forces on the fight against militants in the Islamic State. But they will not be involved in combat.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Tom Bowman

item.title: Additional EU Sanctions Target Russia's Actions In Ukraine
item.description: The latest penalties target Russia's financial, oil and high tech sectors, and slap travel bans and asset freezes on more officials.
item.content:encoded:
The latest penalties target Russia's financial, oil and high tech sectors, and slap travel bans and asset freezes on more officials.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Soraya Sarhaddi Nelson

item.title: In Eastern Ukraine, Citizens Venture Out In Donetsk
item.description: One week into a cease-fire with Russia, the separatist-held eastern Ukrainian city of Donetsk is beginning to come back to life. People are coming out of hiding and buses are back on the streets.
item.content:encoded:
One week into a cease-fire with Russia, the separatist-held eastern Ukrainian city of Donetsk is beginning to come back to life. People are coming out of hiding and buses are back on the streets.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: Judge: Pistorius Guilty Of Culpable Homicide In Girlfriend's Death
item.description: A judge in South Africa has found Oscar Pistorius guilty of culpable homicide, or negligent killing, in the shooting death of his girlfriend Reeva Steenkamp.
item.content:encoded:
A judge in South Africa has found Oscar Pistorius guilty of culpable homicide, or negligent killing, in the shooting death of his girlfriend Reeva Steenkamp.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: ISIS, ISIL Or Islamic State: What's In A Name?
item.description: The disparities in naming are partly because of translation difficulties, and partly a sign of a propaganda war. The group would like to be called IS: the Obama administration is sticking with ISIL.
item.content:encoded:
The disparities in naming are partly because of translation difficulties, and partly a sign of a propaganda war. The group would like to be called IS: the Obama administration is sticking with ISIL.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: Expanding ISIS Fight Scrambles GOP Plan To Extend Budget And Get Out
item.description: House Republicans were hoping for a smooth two weeks before hitting the campaign trial, but a request to arm Syrian rebels has muddled that, as well as the one bill that must pass before they leave.
item.content:encoded:
House Republicans were hoping for a smooth two weeks before hitting the campaign trial, but a request to arm Syrian rebels has muddled that, as well as the one bill that must pass before they leave.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Ailsa Chang

item.title: Susan Rice: Islamic State Fight Will Not Be 'Iraq War Redux'
item.description: In an interview with NPR, Rice said the U.S. will not be drawn into a ground war in Iraq and Syria, even if local forces are insufficient at containing the Sunni militants.
item.content:encoded:
In an interview with NPR, Rice said the U.S. will not be drawn into a ground war in Iraq and Syria, even if local forces are insufficient at containing the Sunni militants.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: Oscar Pistorius Found Not Guility In Girlfriend's Shooting Death
item.description: Audie Cornish talks to BBC reporter Audrey Brown about the Oscar Pistorius trial. On Thursday, a South African judge said the former Olympian is not guilty of premeditated murder in the shooting death of his girlfriend, but said he was negligent in her shooting. Pistorius could still be convicted of culpable homicide.
item.content:encoded:
Audie Cornish talks to BBC reporter Audrey Brown about the Oscar Pistorius trial. On Thursday, a South African judge said the former Olympian is not guilty of premeditated murder in the shooting death of his girlfriend, but said he was negligent in her shooting. Pistorius could still be convicted of culpable homicide.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Obama's ISIS Plan A 'Sunni Awakening: Part Two'
item.description: The Obama administration's strategy for combating the Islamic State relies on ground forces provided by Iraq and Syria because the White House says it will not send U.S. combat troops. In Iraq, that means trying to win back Sunnis in areas where the group controls territory. Something similar happened during the Iraq war: it was called the Sunni Awakening.
item.content:encoded:
The Obama administration's strategy for combating the Islamic State relies on ground forces provided by Iraq and Syria because the White House says it will not send U.S. combat troops. In Iraq, that means trying to win back Sunnis in areas where the group controls territory. Something similar happened during the Iraq war: it was called the Sunni Awakening.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Alice Fordham

item.title: Yemen May Not Offer Best Model For Obama's ISIS Plan
item.description: Gregory Johnsen, author of The Last Refuge: Yemen, al-Qaeda and America's War in Arabia, tells Robert Siegel that President Obama chose a flawed model when he compared the effort to defeat ISIS to U.S. attacks against suspected terrorists in Yemen.
item.content:encoded:
Gregory Johnsen, author of The Last Refuge: Yemen, al-Qaeda and America's War in Arabia, tells Robert Siegel that President Obama chose a flawed model when he compared the effort to defeat ISIS to U.S. attacks against suspected terrorists in Yemen.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Congress Generally Supportive Of Action Against ISIS
item.description: President Obama's request for congressional authorization to help Syrian rebels fight Islamic State militants has thrown a wrench into what was supposed to have been a quiet two weeks on Capitol Hill.
item.content:encoded:
President Obama's request for congressional authorization to help Syrian rebels fight Islamic State militants has thrown a wrench into what was supposed to have been a quiet two weeks on Capitol Hill.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: In Catalonia, Thousands March For Independence From Spain
item.description: Catalans took to the streets on their national day on Thursday, demanding independence from Spain. The wealthy northeast region of Catalonia has its own language and culture.
item.content:encoded:
Catalans took to the streets on their national day on Thursday, demanding independence from Spain. The wealthy northeast region of Catalonia has its own language and culture.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer
